name: ProgressBar
classdesc:
JET Progress Bar

The oj-c-progress-bar element allows a user to display progress of an operation in a rectangular horizontal meter. If a developer does not wish to display the exact value, a value of '-1' can be passed in to display an indeterminate value. 
<oj-c-progress-bar value='{{progressValue}}'></oj-c-progress-bar>

Accessibility

To meet accessibility requirements, use one or more of the following ARIA attributes to provide meaningful text describing the purpose or status of the progress bar for assistive technologies:

  • aria-label
  • aria-labelledby

These ARIA attributes help assistive technologies accurately convey loading status and context to users.

If the progress bar is used to indicate the loading state of a specific region, the region element must have aria-describedby referencing the progress barâ€™s id. Include aria-busy="true" for the duration of the loading. Remove or set it to "false" once loading is complete.

name: max
description:
The maximum allowed value. The element's max attribute is used if it
is provided, otherwise the default value of 100 is used.

name: value
description:
The value of the Progress Bar. The element's value attribute is used if it
is provided, otherwise the default value of 0 is used. For indeterminate Progress, set value to -1.
Any other negative value will default to 0.

name: edge
description:
Whether the progress bar is positioned at the top edge of a container or not.
If set to 'top', the curved borders will be removed.

ojvalues.name: none
ojvalues.description: Not attached progress bar (default, if unspecified)

ojvalues.name: top
ojvalues.description: Progress Bar at Top Edge of container

name: setProperty
description: Sets a property or a single subproperty for complex properties and notifies the component of the change, triggering a corresponding event.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to set. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

params.name: value
params.description: The new value to set the property to.

name: getProperty
description: Retrieves the value of a property or a subproperty.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to get. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

name: setProperties
description: Performs a batch set of properties.

params.name: properties
params.description: An object containing the property and value pairs to set.
